title: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area, Las Vegas
address: 3205 Nevada 159, Las Vegas, NV 89161
review_list:
Beautiful scenery and enjoyable for all ages. The views are picturesque and do not get boring! Quick drive to this area regardless of area of town you're coming from.

Just a short drive from Las Vegas is this gem. Seven dollar entrance fee is worth every penny. Drive around the 13 mile loop and enjoy marvelous mountains with ever changing colors and views.

The day we visited the grand canyon was very windy. The bot we were taken too was a bit unsafe as there were no safety barriers. Flight back from the Canyon was bumpy due to turbulence.
Sky walk was certainly the highlight of the trip.
Check what tour you get before you book.

Bring cash for the admission fee ($7), it is worth every dollar. The entire 14.7 mile loop is amazing and filled with stellar views of nature. The visitor center has a nice gift shop, information, and some wonderful exhibits. Next time I will spend more time exploring the center. The first two pull offs in Calico I and Calico II...


More  



We had extra time and travelled through this canyon stopping frequently to see the many colors and landmarks. We saw the famous burrows, a tortoise and a few birds that live in this arid desert. Our stroll through and along some marked trails we had some great views and wonderful memories.

I would list Red Rock Canyon as my single most necessary stop when visiting Las Vegas. It's only 30 minutes from the strip, provides you with beauty beyond words and some definitely needed exercise after all of the Vegas buffets. There are a multitude of hiking and climbing trails suitable for all fitness levels. If you are very much against...


More  



A beautiful time with nature so close to Las Vegas. The rock formations are very interesting. Got to see an adventurer rappelling down a cliff.

This Canyon is a must see. Nice Scenic drive with places to stop and take beautiful pictures. They have hiking trails and hills. It's a nice escape from the Strip and bright lights of Vegas.

Less than an hour from Las Vegas, open EVERY DAY! - contrary to TA info. $7 fee per car puts you on a winding one-way road through the magnificent canyon. Although there are parking areas, services are limited, so use the toilets and buy water before entering. Worth every minute.

I went here with some friends and really enjoyed the scenery and beauty of this natural state park. Some of the climbing was though but yet enjoyable. If you like the outdoors then you should try this out.

title: Conservatory & Botanical Gardens at Bellagio, Las Vegas
address: Bellagio, 3600 Las Vegas Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Always beautiful. I've seen it in Fall when chrysanthemum display was there and most recently the celebration of Chinese New Year, year of the Monkey. So creative. Not to be missed.

We went in December. Everything was wonderfully decorated for the season. This is a quick and free way to spend an hour of your vacation. I would absolutely return.

I truly enjoyed seeing the potted plant display and caught it before they took down the Chinese New Year theme. I'm not sure what they will have next but I'm sure it's worth stopping in for each different theme! It's really close to the world's largest chocolate fountain too. There is a tea shop near by also. I really liked...


More  



This place is a great location to take pictures. This time they decorated the place with the Lunar New Year theme. Loved all the details they put from the money trees, peach trees, the monkeys and the Chinese dolls. I really enjoyed visiting again. I would definitely recommend spending some time at the Conservatory.

The conservatory and gardens at Bellagio are one of Las Vegas little known secrets. Spectacular floral displays and topiary beyond belief. A perfect respite from the otherwise hectic environment of the strip. Who would think so many flowers and garden displays could be maintained indoors and provided for free public view. Go and enjoy. See the Chahuly glass light displays...


More  



This is always a delightful stop when passing through the Bellagio. If you are coming to see the fountains or dine on the property, be sure to stop in just behind Reception to see this seasonal display of flowers. The fragrant fresh flowers are a welcome change from the smoky casinos of Vegas. My favorite each year is to see...


More  



the exhibit celebrated chinese new year- flowers were wonderful! also note the flowers made of glass in the lobby- a calm beautiful spot off of the excitement of the strip

Not only was it FREE, it was gorgeous to walk through. Worth the time to walk through and get some pretty photos.

Ladies want to drag us guys to see a bunch of flowers! Well we were glad we went for this is the year of Monkey for the Chinese. The exhibit was great, for being around landscaping, some one knew what they were doing. Well worth seeing the exhibit, live KOI fish swimming around..

These gardens are ee to visit. Right now theyare themed for the Chinese New Year. We were there in the morning and the care taker was pulling out any flowers not perfect. We went back at night. Highly recommended to visit both times to compare. Also works by Chilully are there now.

title: Wynn Las Vegas Casino, Las Vegas
address: 3131 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Does not disappoint. Can't find a lot to complain about.. Still the place that all others will compare themselves too. Just a great experience!! You pay for it but it is definitely worth every penny.

This hotel inside and out is just so sleek and stunning. If you can't afford to stay here because it is pretty pricey, make sure you at least go inside, check out the casinos, shops and the exterior designs.

These are not hotels on the Strip, these are towns in their own right.The Wynn is up at the north end and the surrounding trees and waterfalls are a delight.Internally it is just `a stunning world of opulence,eat drink and be merry and as we did go and see the show,Le Reve,outstanding.

I've been here several times and it doesn't pay out, you pay if you play. Just don't play see the show outside and walk over to the mall and spend your money there. Even the penny machine will get you

Would have a higher rating if it were not for the smoking. I cannot believe that smoking is still allowed in casinos

Caught La Reve at the Wynn. The property is new and vibrant. Lots of restaurant and bar choices and the theatre was excellent.

We decided to give the Wynn Buffet a try seeing we heard they did it over and they were competing with the buffet at Ceasars. Well I am glad we tried it but if you are going to spend the money I would recommend going to the Ceasars Buffet. I thought they had much more of a selection then they...


More  



Even though I stayed at Encore by Wynn, the two resorts are connected so I checked out the Wynn's casino area as well. The Wynn's decor in general is the most beautiful on the strip, and this goes for the casino too. It's large but not overwhelming, and the free drink service is fantastic. I never won much money on...


More  



My friends and stopped in the Wynn on our Valentine's Day visit to Las Vegas. It never disappoints. The decor of the Wynn is enough for anyone to appreciate. The whole casino is like a giant work of art with over the top chandeliers and ceiling and wall designs. We didn't gamble much here as the minimums are a bit...


More  



I totally enjoyed the buffet yum it was wonderful. The seafood was outstanding, and my husband and I just fell in love with the service. Our waiter Antonio was outstanding we made a new friend.

title: The Strip, Las Vegas
address: S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Went to Vegas to hangout with friends. The Strip was all that... A lot of walking and people watching. There are restaurants everywhere.

The strip is exceptionally busy and houses the main hotel complexes in Las Vegas.
A lot of beggar type people/street performers along the street.
During the day it is pretty drab but from dusk and dark hours, the strip is well light and looks well.
Pretty noisy too.

I am not sure one person could see it all in one day. There's SO much and its so big. There's something for everyone along The Strip. Get lost shopping, at a casino, or a show, but be sure to keep going because you can always see more. Don't take handouts from people on the street. There is shopping for...


More  



So many sites to see! Bring your very best walking shoes as you will put MILES upon them. Leave the kids at home; there are other vacations appropriate for them.

The hussle and bussel of the strip is amazing theres soo much to see and do and every hotel has something different so go and experience it all.. Watch the costume guys if u get pics then they want tiped :):)

Walking the Strip should be on everyone's bucket list.
I have been going to Vegas consistently for the past 15 years for various reasons and have seen the Strip change, for the better in my opinion.
When I first started to visit Vegas, walking the Strip is more for taking pictures of these magnificent hotels' exterior, and you walk to...


More  



Long, noisy and extreremly colorful. Lots of people and crowds. Lots of amazing shops drinks a modern fair.

The Las Vegas Strip is just an experience. You could spend days walking around and looking at everything. There are plenty of interesting activities for kids, adults, families, and you could do most of it without spending much money at all. It all depends on just how much you want to invest in extracurricular fun. You will find people from...


More  



Everyone should see The Strip at least once in their life...to see it is to believe it....But be forewarned it is bigger than it looks on maps...be prepared to do some walking

Lots to do. Walking is a challenge but there are lots of places near every hotel. Tried the Carnegie Deli at the Mirage. Some items are better than others but the chocolate fudge cake is the "truth"!

title: High Roller, Las Vegas
address: 3545 Las Vegas Blvd South, The Linq, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Following the ads in the taxi cab might not always be the best path to take, but in this case it sure was. We opted for the Happy Half Hour option and that was well worth the price. Going during the day, we had really no wait to speak, just long enough for the bar car to come around. The...


More  



Arrived around 7:30 on a Saturday night. Not much of a wait. Purchased basic tickets. Didn't need to do "open bar" which was quite a bit more for the 1/2 hour ride. There were two of us and we shared the capsule with a nice family group celebrating a 21st birthday. Ride is spectacular. Moves so slowly you don't even...


More  



Boy oh boy did we have a GREAT time. Beauty in every direction. Whether is the canyon or the architecture there is something that everyone will enjoy. The cocktails came quick, were tasty and went down easy. Give it a whirl.

My husband and I actually didn't go on it, but we were right at the base very cool looking!! I wouldn't go on it to scared!!! It costs 25 bucks so bring money!! But from the location the view from the top must be amazing!

In a weekend, where we only had two full days on the ground, this was the only Vegas attraction that we visited **TWICE**. Go at night. Bring your camera. Turn off the flash. You can see everything there is to see of Vegas right from the High Roller. It is taller than the London Eye and taller than the Singapore...


More  



It was nice place to stay but was not happy with drinks they put no tequila at all. Need to take care there customer more

The ride is 20 mins, The best time to visit is at dusk so that you can see some of the day views and then the night lights.

I have been on the High Roller three times and each time I have had a wonderful time. I have been on in the daytime and nighttime and next time want to go around dusk just to see the transformation. I recommend this attraction to all ages!

We went during the day when it wasn't very crowded and had the entire POD to ourselves..I'm sure the view is beautiful at night but during the day we could see the snow covered mountains in the distance..We did the High Roller as part of the BIG BUS tour and it was much cheaper.

I give my overall experience an absolute 10! I would definitely like to come back and visit again!!! All of staff was very kind to me! Thank you!

title: The Mob Museum, Las Vegas
address: 300 Stewart Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89101
review_list:
Informative and entertaining way to spend an afternoon. Well worth the admission price. Displays, videos, interactive moments.

You learn so much from this museum, history inside the FBI files, stories you have partially heard unfolded right infront of your eyes.
Loved it.

This museum was interesting to walk around and read about the history of the mob and police and how they created Las Vegas.
It took a couple of hours to go round as there is so much to read and videos to watch and all of it informative and gives you a real insight to the mob and how they...


More  



If you're looking to learn something about the history of organized crime in the United States when you're in Las Vegas, this is the place for you. Excellent exhibits, some of them interactive, covering some of the bloodiest moments in criminal history. Be sure to budget a minimum of two hours to get a good feel for the three floors...


More  



I would definitely recommend this trip. We went on the valentines day massacre aniversary and the exhibits were awesome. It is so informative and has a link between the mob and Las Vegas. Well worth the money.

This museum is very well done. It's in an old, restored building with 3 floors of exhibits. It's a good way to spend a few hours. The gift shop is excellent also. I go the Mob Museum-Neon museum ticket package.

An excellent 3 hours in the mob museum. I went with someone who is very interested in the history of the mob and the museum was able to surprise him with a fact or two. The exhibits are excellent and the court house area is particularly good. The Saint Valentines Day Massacre Wall is very good.

The Mob Museum is downtown Vegas . Easy to fine. It is in the old Courthouse. The building is very well taken care of. The Museum has 3 floors. You start on the 3rd floor. The pictures , displays are wonderful. It is a place to take the family. The kids will love it. Some hands on exhibitions. Amazing to...


More  



Located in the old federal courthouse, this is an extensive history of organized crime, not just its impact on Vegas. Three floors, starting on 3 and working your way down. Plan on taking several hours to go through. It can be very graphic with many pictures of Mob violence, so it is not a place for children. Teenagers could handle...


More  



The husband and I were looking forward to this Museum and it was to be a highlight of our 6-night Vegas trip! Sadly, it is very out-of-order and scattered over three floors. The information was all readable but not in date order, and not interactive at all, so I can't say "kid-friendly." We purchased the "line-up" photos although never received...


More

title: Hoover Dam Bypass, Las Vegas
address: U.S. Route 93, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
it s nice also you should stop there on your way to the grand canyon, it s a great place nice views .

With Hoover Dam you just get to fly over as part of the tour to the grand canyon. At the dam, lake meade is also here.

So many lessons to learn. So much beauty to behold. Love architecture, perfect stop for you. A definite MUST when in Nevada.

This was a stop on our bus tour to the Grand Canyon and really neat to see since before 2010 or so the by pass didn't exist and you had to go over the dam not really getting to see it. Now you can stop and take pictures and get a better view. We didn't stay too long as it...


More  



amazing I like history and this was a thrill to see and walk on. It is very well organized. I think people should stop and really look at all the American people have done in a really short amount of time that we have been a country. We are so lucky to be able to look at our history with...


More  



Don't miss the Hoover Dam if you're in the Las Vegas area. It is one of the most spectacular feats of modern engineering you'll ever see. Short 45 minute drive from the Strip. Paid ten bucks to park on the way in, but you can save the money by continuing on, and stopping in one of the small parking areas...


More  



The view is pretty cool, but you can see great views from the dam. The bridge is quite a structure - we happen to get there around sunset, which made for some amazing photography.

The overpass is built above the road so you do not see the wires holding the road intact. In fact you feel that you are on a bridge. A short drive from the strip and a lot cheaper. Right next door to Lake Meade National forwest

You can usually purchase a tour to the Grand Canyon that includes a stop at Hoover Dam, it's worth the extra few bucks, some great picks and some interesting history.

Took a break from the Casino's and went for a drive to the dam and back. Very interesting history of the area and the construction of the dam itself. You can still see the old tunnels cut into the rock that were used to get access to the area.

title: Titanic: The Artifact Exhibition, Las Vegas
address: Luxor Hotel Last Vegas, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
We really enjoyed this exhibition, lots of actual titanic recovered artefacts. You certainly get a good feel for the ship and the people that would have been onboard. We got cheap entry tickets from tix for tonight on the strip.

While I do agree it was rather pricey, the artifacts and story were spellbinding. The layout was well planned.

This exhibit was a smaller version than some cities, yet still enjoyable. It's a great experience for the family. We were in awe of the section of the ship on display that was recovered. Just in awe!

Some good artifacts and a good experience ...but they wouldn't let you take any pictures inside...so you couldn't save any memories from this visit

It's hard to tell a story everyone already knows. This exhibit surpassed all my expectations. Bringing humanity and artifacts together was amazing. Walking through really felt like I could have been on the ship. The starry night sky was so captivating. The design and presentation kept both myself and son captivated. I loved this so did he.

A great exhibition presented sensitively with an excellent visitor experience: it's designed to guide you chronologically through events but also through the decks of the ship, starting in 3rd class and working up to the upper class deck where it's made up as the conditions (weather etc) of the night of the disaster. The ice block and the 'Big Piece'...


More  



The Titanic exhibit is a journey from beginning to end, and a worthwhile experience. All of the artifacts are beautifully displayed with interesting information about each of them, and the reconstructions are breathtaking at times. There are quite a few poignant moments as you walk through, so don't be surprised if you get a little misty-eyed. I especially love the...


More  



We were looking forward to this mainly to see the big piece of the ship they have. The artifacts and all the stories were kinda cool too. But that chunk of steel is just mind boggling for me. Glad we got to see this and the Luxor hotel was cool too...

Very well put together! Seeing all the artifacts and even being given the name of an actual Titanic passenger gave me greater sympathy for the people involved. It was also amazing to see a piece of the ship in person.

I have visited museums that present information about the Titanic before however this was something different. The layout was really interesting and the rooms were designed to feel and look like a boat. There was one door that we went through and walked into a room designed like the deck of a boat-with stars on the wall and slightly chilled...

The inside of the tower is much less thrilling than the outside. There are a few thrill rides at a semi-reasonable price. I paid $149.99 for the skyjump with the video footage and photos which also included access to the top deck to see the incredible views.

Great Views especially at night when you can see the whole of Vegas lit up!!! An older hotel/casino but still a good one. If not staying there u need to check it out and go to the top. While at the top, no matter what age u need to hit up one or all of the rides at the top. I recommend the Big Shot for sure. Killer view of Vegas

We stayed at the Stratosphere recently, and Tower admission was included in the daily resort fee. Otherwise, its $20 bucks for the elevator ride up, an even more if you want to go on some of the thrill rides at the top of the Tower. The view is spectacular during the day and night. We stayed at the Stratosphere for my birthday. The tower was so awesome. The views are beautiful. What a great find. We will come back and definitely stay again.

A truly fantastic view from up high of Las Vegas. Especially enjoyed the crazy people doing all the crazy rides offered with the bungee jump off the tower turning my stomach. My fear of heights forbid my body from partaking in these rides bur really enjoyed watching them.

I thought this 'museum' was overpriced for what is a collection of old neon signs....mostly non-working. The guide was very good with lots of history, but mostly only of interest to American citizens. Interesting, but I find it difficult to recommend at the price.

Booked the Neon Museum & the Mob Museum at a rate of $30 for the pair, both interesting in their own rights.
We were staying on the strip so we booked a Lyft, which dropped us right outside. Now, you MUST book a tour, without this you can’t walk round the Museum, which is actually a yard (large yard).
We...

I loved this outdoor museum! We had a great tour guide & were happy that they supply the group with umbrellas since it was a super sunny day! We took the 7pm tour. There were about 20 people total on the tour. Our tour guide was great and knowledgable. This place is doing a great service but taking old NEON signs and refurbishing them. I do recommend buying your tickets online well before you trip, since these sell out quickly. There's a great gift shop in the lobby...

We had a fantastic time at the museum, very educational fun and photogenic. Highly recommended hour tour. Worth the price and then some. Guides really know their stuff, we learned things about neon and vegas we did not know.

My daughters & I purchased online combo tickets which gave us great entry fees on both the Neon & Mob Museums. It was fantastic, very interesting, the guide very informative.

Make reservations, tours sell out even on a Monday. Lots of history about the signs and their background. You cannot walk around on your own. Can get hot, they have umbrellas you can use for shade. Tour is about 90 minutes. Bring a bottle of water.

title: Fremont Street Experience, Las Vegas
address: 425 Fremont Street, Las Vegas, NV 89101
review_list:
We went along after having spent a few days on the 'main' part of the strip. This area is worth visiting for its history with casinos etc but is very run down. Was good to go to pass some time but wouldn't be bothered about going back.

Everyone has to visit Fremont Street to see the laser show. Display is on every evening from around 6pm or 7pm and is on every hour on the hour.
Can get rather busy. When you go hold on to your personal belongings as the area is known for pickpocketing.

Want to experience the truly wild side of Vegas? How about dining on a dollar with menus that won't disappoint. Free slot pulls, busker shows, thrill rides and more! Fremont Street should be on your list of to-do's before you leave for home.

Fremont used to be the place to go. The casinos and buffets tried harder to beat the allure of the new strip. Not so much anymore. Only D's casino had any charm. Fremont has becomes seedier over the years. Some the casinos looked filthy in the daylight. Scam artists greet tourists as soon as they leave the casinos. I'll take...

We had no idea what to expect out of Fremont Street, only that we knew it was the "old Las Vegas"...we DEFINITELY didn't expect the light shows, live music, and crazy atmosphere!
First off, you walk right into the bright lights of Vegas -- those old school casino lights you see in movies. The whole street is covered overhead, and...

The live music was awesome.Check out the casinos while there. They offer more comp's than on the strip.

Every one told me I HAD to see this canopy of lights down town so I was hyped up about it. It was ok but I didn't really care for the patriotic theme especially with Obama at the end. I did enjoy visiting down town and would have liked to explore it longer but our shuttle to it was only...

We walked through the streets and enjoyed the good music. We really enjoyed the ceiling video and all the fun stuff to do. We wanted to do the zip line but ran out of time. It's fun to wander down Fremont Street to see a different "street party" type of Las Vegas experience. It appears that this might be the part of Las Vegas where more of the locals go (but that is just an observation). Good for a change of pace one night during your visit if you are in Vegas for several days.

I could have stayed here for hours. How fun! There was an 80s cover band, street dancers, street artists, casinos, restaurants, a freestyle rap contest, zip lines, and so much more. What a blast!

title: Pinball Hall of Fame, Las Vegas
address: 1610 E. Tropicana, Las Vegas, NV 89119
review_list:
The entrance is free, but the games will cost anywhere from a quarter to a dollar. They have more than just pinball; this is a place with classic games, and it is a blast. It's a large room, and all of the games are side-by-side. Great fun for the entire family!

What a joy spending the afternoon playing pinball! It brought back many good memories and the time flew by. Great place to take kids.

Let me start by saying I am a little bias as i grew up spending far too many hours playing pinball both as a teenager and in my early 20s. Since turning into somewhat of an adult (39 and married) I have not had much of an opportunity to indulge one of my great joys for the last 10-15 years,...


More  



At first, entering the facility was not that impressive. But the more I walked around the and saw all the games we use to play, it got a bit nostalgic. It was like being transformed back to my kid days. Had a great time. The only downside was that not all games were up and running.

The Pinball Hall of Fame is not your typical museum. It is a collection of collections of vintage and recent pinball machines from famous manufactures like Gottlieb, Chicago Coin, Williams and Bally. You'll find classics from the 1950's through the 1980s as well as machines from the 1920's and 1930's. You'll also find a few of the other arcade games...


More  



This is a must do on my list. If you like pinball don't miss this. It is pinball vintage to the max.. great big place. Hours of fun. Some of these old vintage machines were rescued and have a little interesting story attached.

We took our children to check out the pinball extravaganza one afternoon and enjoyed playing some older games and newer games that we don't see as often. title: The Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian, Las Vegas

Would definitely recommend.

It was amazing how at a reasonable cost we were able to find interesting and unique gifts. If you have the room in your luggage it can be worth the time.

This is quite an amazing place, compares to nothing you know - massive shopping areas, all high end shops while wandering in a mini replica of Venice and a very well done false blue sky - priceless!

The Grand Canal and Shoppes are hands down the best I've ever been to. The theme is fantastic and so well done, it's clean, it's perfectly maintained and very cool offering a much needed break from not only the heat but the gambling.

Abuot 40 miles north of Vegas, Mt. Charleston is a great day get away to enjoy nature and have lunch at the lodge. Food is Pub food, it's ok. Service is OK.

Some of the most iconic cars ever made!
Free tours too!

called into Shelby museum as part of the Pawn Stars Tour, great place if you are into old cars, cost nothing to go into to look.

My great friend picked me up when we were in Las Vegas last month. One of many stops on my personal tour off the Strip, was the Shelby Museum. We took the daily tour and learned many stories about the legend, Carroll Shelby. We saw many amazing cars including a $24 million one. Fun stop over with many great finds in the the gift shop. Staff is eager to share stories and help in any way. Very close to the Vegas Strip too.

Never pass up a free attraction in Vegas that the entire family can enjoy. I recommend taking the morning tour so you can go into the shop and watch employees working on vehicles. review_list:
Something mesmerizing about the fountain set to music. The patterns of the jets are unbelievably individual for each different piece of music. It leaves one rather in awe of the amount of engineering involved to make each performance unique.

Incredible to see and watch !! The choreography is spectacular and you are mesmerized during the entire show.

The Bellagio fountains are always a sight to see. It was an awesome experience with my husband having a romantic walk on the strip watching the water and listening to the music. The ducks put on a show also.

One of the must sees in Vegas.

Amazing that the only word i can use the video does no justice this is a must...i actually became emotional it was breath taking

This Cirque show is awesome, very lively, lots, and lots, to see. Very good stunts, awesome depiction of the Beatles and that era. We had a fun time singing right along with all the songs. I won some coin here so, yea, I'm going to write a good review. It's a shiny masterpiece that everyone ought to see. Newer than most hotels on the strip, it's laid out with room to stretch. No claustrophobia here. High ceilings. Glitzy and glamorous!

Nice casino,areas around it. Beautiful artwork. But the machines don't pay out , just admire the scenery and save your money for the spa. Plan on staying at the spa all day,you won't forget it.

Everything about the Cosmopolitan, including the casino, feels unique compared to the other resorts on the strip. With MGM owning so many of the resorts, many of them start to blend together a bit. But Cosmo has done an excellent job bucking that trend. The casino areas are cavernous, with different bars scattered throughout. The slot machines are a lot...


More  



Very nice and hotel. Very clean, artwork very sofisticated. Would have loved to stay here. Next trip to Vegas will be here definitely not the rip-off Cromwell

This hotel is unbelievable and it all starts with the casino. The whole thing is spectacular looking which makes it an even better place to play at. Sitting with a good group at the tables is so much fun (Especially when your winning!)

Beautiful relatively new casino. The cocktail waitresses and gaming attendants were all lovely. Checkout the secret pizza place and buy a slice or two, delicious. while were were here there was also an ice skating rink set up. Lots of places to have a meal although not cheap. Checkout the chandelier from the glass elevator, stunning!

As a seasoned Vegas Vet, my husband and I have discovered the Cosom offers the best exchange rate available. It's usually 3% better than the best bank rate back home. If you save your receipt you can exchange any amererican back to Canadian at the same rate.

nice casino, very clean, low smoke smell, everyone very friendly. Enjoyed my time in there. Very Modern feel, machines are well spaced and up to date

The whole fist floor is packed with slot machines. Played a little slot machines and blackjack...I wasn't there to gamble.

title: Las Vegas Premium Outlets - South, Las Vegas
address: 7400 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV 89123
review_list:
This is a great place to shop with the likes of Calvin Klein, Tommy Hilfeiger. There are also 2 small food courts here and the best shop in the complex is the Kipling Store. Up to 50% off certain models of bags and if you spend over $100 you get extra discount applied.

Not as good as North outlet mall. Bit off the beaten track so you have to change on the bus route. Annoying stall holders constantly bothering you to buy goods.

Plenty of shoes shops and a mixture of other outlets. You need to dig about to find a decent bargain but worth a visit. Take the SDX bus which drops you off outside.

Great shopping centre with a good mix of high end outlets, all having a good range of stock. I was shopping for men's wear and found the Jockey shop great value for your smalls and the polo shop for everything else. As a tourist, you should make a point of hitting this centre. Is about on par with the North,...


More  



We took the express bus from the Strip to the outlets which worked well.
The usual suspects - Ralph Lauren, Hilfiger, Gap, Van Heusen are all there. The prices are generally good but we also scored some bargains at the Fashio Show mall.
Two perfectly adequate food courts and the obligatory Starbucks.

Shops are not as great as the North Premium Outlet Mall and shoppers are more locals. Parking can be challenging and walkways are narrow inside the mall. High end stores are outside the mall where more budget driven stores are inside. Feels more like a regular mall then an outlet mall.

But don't necessarily let that put you off - there are less designer stores but more bargains here than at the North Outlets,
The touts selling things are a pest - don't know why mall management allows them - but determined outlet shoppers can ignore them

These outlets are disgusting. There was only one or two good stores but to get to them you have to go inside to a stinky mall area and walk past kiosks -I wish I got the name of the one kiosk where I was literally cussed out for telling the man no thank you as he chased behind us cussing...


More  



Don't waste your vacation here. There are no stores you don't have at home, and no deals you can't find elsewhere. Fashion Show Mall has better options if you want to shop (and I love me some shopping) but I wish we hadn't gone out of our way to visit this. Sad :(

When you're from Europe and you're in LV, be sure to go to the Premium Outlet to buy some Levi trousers. They are very cheap (40 USD all) and the service in the store is great (the employees help you really well as well). Definitely go there, you will not be disappointed.

title: Downtown Container Park, Las Vegas
address: 707 Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV 89101
review_list:
I liked this place. It's clean and weird with unusual little shops. Not big, took about an hour-ish with going into some (not all) places. The coffee shop window and the Jinju chocolate shop make the stop worth it on their own. We were there during the day and it was warm so it was great to walk around.

A fun place to stop by and grab a snack. It has a playground for the kids in the middle, so they can burn off some energy while you shop or grab a snack.

Found this unique park/shopping venue by accident walking along Fremont Street at the far-end (just past the El Cortez) beyond where you might think anything of touristy interest would exist! Have been there twice, first time last year and now a year later. It was busier on our previous visit, fairly quiet this time around.
As others have said, the...


More  



Found this location by mistake. Strange location downtown just down from Fremont street. The mantis out front is scary and loud at night when she lights up, great play area for the kids and food stores to eat at offering a wide range of shops. Kids are kicked out at 8 or 9pm on the dot.

Downtown Container Park has something for everyone. Dinner and a drink for adults, great supervised play area for kids. Be sure to check out the fire breathing sculpture at the entrance to the park. Blasts are coordinated with music, and it's an impressive feat of engineering to boot. We ate at Big Ern's BBQ. Food was excellent, and the price...


More  



My wife had seen an article about this unique shopping area made from re-purposed shipping containers and thought it would be nice to visit. "An open-air shopping center filled with boutique retail shops, unique restaurants, and live entertainment." is what their website described. Located downtown at the end of the Fremont Street Experience is this shopping/cafe attraction. Parking is all...


More  



Our second time to visit this place. Great little shops with local artists work and great little restaurants. Great play ground for kids. Nice music venue too.

Interesting location. When a billionaire tries something new it can be very interesting. Container park started by the Zappos guy is one of those things. I am not sure how it is making money but has some unigue shops and things to see in the area. He is trying very hard to bring life back to Downtown!

If by chance you bring your kids to Vegas.....this might be a place to come. Great playground area for kids and kid friendly eateries. Some neat and interesting shops for adults, too.

This is a must see place to take visitors and kids. The play area looks quite fun. The shops are unique and varied if not a little on the expensive side. We bought socks and cute clothes for the grands.

title: Ellis Island Casino & Brewery, Las Vegas
address: 4178 Koval Lane, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Food is good. Portion sizes are large enough to share. Staff is friendly. The location might seem a bit sketchy but this is Great Value

Wow!!! The food here is unbelievable! We were referred here by an Uber driver who said that a lot of locals and tourists rave about the cheap, yet delicious food. If you sign up for their gaming card, you can get a very cheap steak dinner (I want to say $.7.99) and it was way more delicious than I had...


More  



Prime rib served was 1 1/2 inches thick, cooked to medium rare perfection. The side salad, baked potato and green beans were unmentionable they were so bland. The house root beer was KILLER! They also serve an outstanding omelet in the morning. Again, the toast was cold and weak but the potatoes and omelet were outstanding. Service was top notch...


More  



Ellis Island Casino & Brewery never disappoints me. I go there every time when I in Las Vegas which is one every two years. It is off the strip. Food good at a reasonable cost. Great promotions! Friendly staff that are willing to help be successful with your gambling adventures. I appreciate that as I am not a seasoned gambler....


More  



Just a few minute walk behind the strip. Great little place to gamble, a couple of tables and lots of slots, great pays!

This place was easy to get to. had good food and very good prices for the food. We did breakfast here a couple times and were very full when we were done.

Located just to the rear of Bally's on Koval Rd its a gem and not difficult to get to, Okay its small and full of local's but were visited many times and never felt uncomfortable. It has its own micro brewery and the Blonde beer we both drank from the bar was $2.25 a pint and was great.
We always...


More  



I love this place. #1 microbrwery in town, awesome customer service. Always fun to go, and great table limits, and a crowd that is great to be with. We come here every chance we get. I like it becasue the small size, yet a complete package

We went there for superbowl party it was very nice very well organized the staff was very friendly. There were a couple people that we saw complain about were they were seated but I say get there early. There were ten of us we all had a great time . There beer is really good nice and cold! A nice...


More  



Just a hole in the wall casino that is so much fun!! Bartenders were awesome and the dealers were SO MUCH FUN!!! Played $5 blackjack for hours of laughter and good times!!

title: The National Atomic Testing Museum, Las Vegas
address: 755 East Flamingo Road, Las Vegas, NV 89119 (Formerly Atomic Testing Museum)
review_list:
This tells an amazing story that I never knew how huge and large our testing program was-----and why we had to keep doing it. Should see this story, it is very interesting. I found groupon--making this a great deal

The museum was very interesting, but all the information was almost too overwhelming. It was a lot of reading, but I still appreciate the effort that was made to help us understand such a complicated topic. It was also fun to go to the extra exhibit - Area 51...myth or reality?!

We spent 2 1/2 hours in this museum. What a surprise. It was a fascinating insight into an historic era... I fully expected to blast through (pun intended) but the exhibits were intriguing and well presented. I learned things and relearned things I had forgotten. Probably best for the 50 and older crowd that know more about WWII and the...


More  



The Cold War always had the potential to get extremely hot!! The tip of the spear was developed and tested in Nevada and here is where you can learn about the lives of the people dedicated to the testing and development of atomic energy as a weapon and as an energy source. It was not without risk and it was...


More  



Learn all about the Atomic testing that was conducted in Nevada. Learn the myths and the truths about it. View artifacts and photos from the Test Site. The Museum is self guided but docents are available for question and answer. Plenty of parking Wheelchair ad walker accessible. Clean and orderly restrooms and a nice gift shop.

I did not think I would enjoy this as much as I did. It is a walk through a time when things were so different and a look at Nevada's history. It was really interesting and a part of history that is often left out. Really recommend it for families and kids.

Unique museum covering a topic I didn't know much about. I loved the various expressions of atomic-related pop culture, but some of the other exhibits could be dry, especially in the copywriting. Interesting gift shop where I picked up a very small sample of Trinitite. I saw no need to bother with the sensationalistic exhibits like the one on UFOs.

A very informative and well thought-out museum. Area 51 exhibit doesn't allow photos, but a very interesting and entertaining exhibit.

The museum was really well put together and I especially liked that there was information about the cultural and environmental effects of the tests. I was pleased that the museum also had an exhibit specifically about Native American land use before the tests were conducted.
The information targeted all levels, from those who have a passing interest to those with...


More  



There is a wealth of information at this Smithsonian-affiliated museum, perhaps too much to take in on a single visit. The filmed interviews and narratives are fascinating and there is as much technical detail as any non-physicist could ask for. We took our time and still found ourselves dizzy at the amount of info and slightly depressed by the "Peace...


More

title: Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood, Las Vegas
address: 3667 S. Las Vegas Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
If you want to shop at places you typically spend your money at, this is the place. I joked that I couldn't afford to walk in many of the places that offer shopping around here. The ceiling is so cool with the clouds. I saw this in several places I knew were separate (Forum near Caesar's and another place I...


More  



Nice place to shop! Great selection of shops with affordable options. Great number of places to eat also!

This is decidedly a less "can you top this?" Mall. Lots of decent restaurants, a couple of theaters, and friendly shops.

Great place to shop. Wide selection of stores here so whatever you're looking for they probably have. Nice alternative to your traditional mall experience. There are several shows that can be seen at the Planet Hollywood so buy your tickets while you're here. There are several kiosks that sell them.

The best shopping center in las vegas! You can find something to eat and drink, and also you can shop from the affordable stores

Good selection of shops and some different to those found in other hotels.
A number of places to eat and would recommend trying some popcorn at Garretts popcorn shop.
Is most likely a selection of shops to suit travellers at all budgets. Good location nearly in the central part of the strip.

On a recent trip to Las Vegas we strolled through the Mile High Mall before we saw a play. It was great..Clean,very attractive, lots of places to shop with much variety. Next time we are in the area we will allow time for more strolling.

My SO and I stopped by the Miracle Mile Shops to see the rainstorm and to look for a wristlet to replace one I had forgotten to pack. The shopping options are a mix of high-end, reasonable, and unique shops. I managed to find a plain black wristlet pretty quickly at Fossil for $60. The staff in the shops were...


More  



This review doesn't have anything to do with the Miracle mile as everything was good but I couldn't leave a review about a particular shop anywhere else so here goes...I was really excited to visit this store for a goblet and sweets on offer and was left very disappointed. The 2 members of staff were very unhelpful and disinterested in...


More  



There are a number of basic mall stores but there is also a good mix of upper end and unique shops to explore. Well laid out with maps.

title: The Auto Collections, Las Vegas
address: 3535 Las Vegas Boulevard South, The LINQ Hotel & Casino, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Museum of vintage cars is located in the Imperial Palace Casino. Here collected 250 vintage cars. Deserves your visit :)

Very good display of many cars some very rare good place to spend a couple of hours. check the internet before you go as there are discount coupons.

Over the past two decades the quality of this collection has been depleted by a sell-off of numerous vehicles (you can buy most of the cars you see there) it still is worth a look-see, particularly by car enthusiasts...and memory seekers. There are usually coupons available that will allow you free entry to the show.

There are all different cars represented. A selection of them are available to purchase. Free tickets available online print before you leave home as the Hotel no longer will give them to you upon request. If you forget there is a printing station in the hotel but you have to pay $5 to use it!

A nice collection of cars for all eras on the top floor of the Linq. Best to go on line and print out a coupon for free entry before you go.

...you shouldn't bother with this attraction. But if you like cars or love them, if you have SOME knowledge of the art and science of automobiles, this is your place. Room after room of fascinating and unique vehicles, some the height of the automotive art. There may be good and sound reasons why "they don't make them like that anymore",...


More  



Jimmy Velvet was there when we visited and we spoke with him for over an hour. He was with Elvis in the early years and has an amazing photograph collection. He photographed many many celebrities that were close to Elvis.

We enjoy looking at cars. we have three of our own. Long way to walk from our drop off. Needed to rest a bit in between.

We got there at 4:30 they close at 5. The girl at the desk gave us a discount since we could only have a 1/2 hour (we thought that was really nice) the cars were amazing, wish we had a bit more time to read the history but getting to see all the history was great. Good place for anybody...


More  



One of the best load of cars I've ever seen, the cars are in fabulous condition and for sale, they range from vintage Rolls Royce to an XJ220 Jaguar and some lovely 50's American classics.
A must see for car lovers. My only grumble was the dozy old coot you pay on the way in, he asked both my parents...


More

title: The LINQ, Las Vegas
address: 3545 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Not to big, not to small. Very friendly dealers on the table games.
Clean and modern looking
You don't feel like you are packerd in.

Two of my girlfriends and I took a few days and traveled to Las Vegas. We chose The LinQ Hotel because its location was great and the price was right. Like all of the LV hotels, the walk from the drop-off to registration was a hike but no big deal. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms...


More  



Since this hotel was just recently remodeled I had very high expectations before my arrival. Yes the rooms were very clean, but they were very small. The bathroom door was a sliding door, but was not very safe as there was no stop on it and you could have easily smashed or even worse, your fingers if you didn't close...


More  



overall better than average probably would go again, but would not go out of my way to get there. I will give credit for outside cleanliness tho

Until this last trip, I only visited the Linq for O'Sheas. However, this trip I spent more time in the full casino and the dining. It is a very clean, cool, and energetic environment. I don't normally like visiting casinos or staying on the strip, however, I plan on staying here next trip I was so impressed!

Enjoyed eating and playing at the LINQ. Friendly dealers and did not have to wait a long time for table games.

Very clean, friendly, and fun atmosphere! Casino games were fun and exciting. Looking forward to come back!

The big wheel at the Linq is well worth a visit. It wasn't busy so there was no ques & there was only us & another couple in the pod. The views are just brilliant over the city you can see for miles.

You know I have to say I really enjoy coming to the LINQ! As a local, there are not very many places that you may feel like going especially when it involves going down to the strip. The LINQ is located right next to the FLAMINGO hotel and casino. The energy here is all good vibes, and I highly suggest...


More  



Great hotel on the Las Vegas Strip. Rooms were spacious with basic amenities. Hotel is between the Flamingo and Harrahs and right next to the High Roller.

title: Casino at the MGM Grand, Las Vegas
address: 3799 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
MGM Grand is a great place to see a concert. There's a lot to do in and around the MGM Grand and it's easy to get to. There are a lot of walkways. Beautiful on the outside. Great food inside. There was so much to do inside the casino it was hard to pick. Played a few games, drank some...


More  



This is a casino on steroids. Very exciting and attractive interior. Action throughout. Busy 24 hours a day.

I am a little biased as we did win some coin at the duck hunt slot machine tucked way in the back of the casino, but we always stop here to gable, eat and people watch. The place is just too massive for me to stay for the night (prefer Bellagio) but the restaurants and ambiance make for a pleasant...


More  



While I don't gamble often (or high dollar amounts), I find MGM to be a comfortable place to dabble and entertain myself for a while.

So far I am giving all the casinos in LV the same 3 bubble rating because nothing has stuck out at me as anything better or worse than the others. Granted, I am not a high roller but all of the casinos give you the same basic service or non service depending on how much you spend.
The casino is...


More  



We ended up at the casino after seeing the Jabbawockeez show at the MGM Grand. The casino was a fun experience and we enjoyed the restaurants as well.

We stayed at the MGM Signature so went through and enjoyed the casino quite a bit. There are machines and table games for all budgets. It was moderately smokey.

The MGM sits on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and West Tropicana, near the end of the Strip where the action starts to wane. It's a huge casino/hotel - so big that you may get disoriented inside. The tram that runs along the Strip makes a stop here, which is convenient. Across the street on W. Tropicana is Hooters...


More  



We stayed at the Signature at MGM and came to the casino to gamble. We truly had a blast. The five of us had some great laughs and even won some money.

Its an easy going casino with friendly staff. I really liked it as I came away with actual winnings from the roulette tables!
Its spread out around the restaurants and bars and there is something available for everyone. Just like all other casinos, there are people around at all times of the day or night.

title: Flamingo Wildlife Habitat, Las Vegas
address: 3555 Las Vegas Blvd S, Flamingo Las Vegas, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Its free and centrally located. Shaded so you can escape the sun in the summer. Can get crowded. Plenty of cafe's and restaurants around, even more now the Linq has opened

Little bit of unexpected green and tranquility just off the strip. Worth a visit if passing for some smoke free air and nautral light.

Great to grab a buffet and watch the flamingos and wildlife from your table. A stroll through the park is a great place to take pictures and and just sit and relax.

We visited the Habitat as part of our Monorail tour.
It's quite small and hardly a nature park but it does make a pleasant break from the more obvious helter-skelter attractions of Vegas.
Lots of turtles and flamingos in a relatively tranquil setting.

The iconic home of Bugsy is host to this lovely creatures....Pink and graceful to look at..... It's also a nice quiet and cool Oasis in the middle of the strip..... Not much to do besides looking at the birds and gardens...... Grab a cool drink of your choice and wonder the grounds, or take a load off and chill....... It's...


More  



The Habitat is very peaceful and beautiful all the way around. Rare ducks and geese prance around the man made creek with a cool looking waterfall. You will see pelicans,coy,Flamingos and plush trees. Take a nice little walk around the place.

This is a nice space to sit and relax with the sounds of the small water features throughout the area. the wildlife is small in numbers however provides the allure of being much larger. There are many benches and spots that would be an excellent place to just sit and read or take in the atmosphere of the area.

a few minutes from your gambling schedule to take a breath in a relaxing environment to gather your thoughts before hitting thr slots again

It was a freakishly hot day when we visited here so it was good to be able to stop for a few minutes and take a bit of a rest. Our five year old absolutely adored the flamingos, ducks and the fish (it turned out to be the highlight of her day). We arrived far too early to watch the...


More  



Visited here whilst wandering down the strip, a very nice little area to take a break from the hustle and bustle. Worth it if you're in the area and have 5 minutes to spare.
Heads up too there were some really nice guys taking photos with parrots and such here, I believe there were three different pairs, normally we wouldn't...


More

title: Casino at New York - New York, Las Vegas
address: 3790 Las Vegas Blvd. South, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
Ok I didn't stay here when I visited in February however I'm noisy .... Lol
I can't tell you what the rooms are like however
The casino is all in the middle which I really liked.... All around the outside was the streets of New York!! The out side was well and truly themed on New York!!
If I went...


More  



We have seen this casino open, enjoy good times and slowly look a little worn down. Still a fun time but really needs updating. Seems to also cater to families with small children. Noisy!

It helped that we stayed at NYNY so we spent a lot of time gambling there. They have a wide selection of machines, from the old to the new. Pennies, nickels, quarters and dollar machines. Drink service is good most times of the day. After 9:00 in the evening it gets rather loud and more crowded.

Slot machines, Blackjack, craps, baccarat-you name it, they've got it! A huge central bar, numerous peripheral bars, and cocktail girls make this casino an adult playground!

Before any gambling make sure you register for a players card. On the afternoon we visited we had a considerable wait but if you intend to do some serious spending its worthwhile. The casino is a considerable size with something for everyone. The waitresses are friendly and work hard so ensure you tip. There are lots of eating and drinking...


More  



Enjoyed New York-New York. The Atmosphere is excellent and it reminds you of walking down the street in New York City. The pub is great and had awesome drink special and happy hours. The Roller-coaster is unique both inside and outside. Over-all a great Casino to visit and hang out. The poker slots were pretty loose on Jacks and higher.

It's what you'd expect from the name--loud, raucous, busy. The dealers know their stuff and are at least moderately friendly. Very professional and not at all stuffy. I don't do that well or that poorly here, but I play here each trip and have a lot of fun because the atmosphere, including the employees, make it that way.

So not being much of a casino person I didn't spend too long in the casino but when I did it was great. The croupiers were great, friendly and helpful and the waitress service is great, that's if you like free drinks! (Woo hoo). They even come and massage you at the tables. Now I know in the long run...


More  



We always stop there a couple time when in Vegas. We love their Irish pub and go there a lot at their afternoon happy hour for appetizer's and pints of cider. It's having a lot of renovations done, but should be about done by now and should be an even nicer casino now.

I did not enjoy the casinos, but I had to stop by and look at them all. But seriously once you've been into the Bellagio or Caesars Palace it's like stepping into a third world country in some of the other casinos.
New York is a mid range casino I'd say, cheaper if that's what you're looking for. But I...

review_list:
We went to Pawn Stars, Count's Kustoms And Rick's. Rick's was the best. Took the $5 tour(veterans were free, thank you) and all the main stars were actually there working (Rick, Kelly, Rob, Tyler & Brettly).
Kelly was very nice (in more ways than one :) ) and actually sold us the tour tickets. Brettly walked through the souvenir shop...

We saw a few of his workers that are on the TV show. We also had our picture with Ricks oldest son from the TV show. Very nice of him. It is best to visit there between 2-3:30 pm. You might be able get get your picture with Rick. We missed doing it by 5 minutes. I was disappointed since...

would have been better if you could have met some of the people involved in the show. they have some nice restored items that have been on the show. sort of feel like your in a fish bowl looking out into the different areas were the work is being done $25 to have something signed was a bit expensive. More  



After watching the show on tv i was surprised to actually see "Rick" working at his shop just like on the show! But to me the greatest part was seeing all of the antique item waiting to be restored or already restored.

It was very cool seeing all the things to be restored as well as items that had already been restored. But, if you want a picture with Rick, be ready to shell out $25. That's what it costs.

It was very interesting to see how the guys work their magic on those rusty antiques......the $5 tour was worth it, but the only disappointment was that we didn't see anyone working, and did't see Rick, even though he was there. They have a nice gift shop if you'd like a mug or t- shirt.

Came here not knowing what to expect. Stopped in and met RIck's daughter and brother. These people a real and so nice! Unlike the Pawn Stars they are here and working and take time to chat. Visited Ricks Restorations as part of a pawn stars tour. It was a short but interesting tour of the new site, but no photos are allowed inside the work areas, only the front reception area. I've been there last month with my family expecting some interesting but the tour is quick and there is not much to see. As a tourist I expected more.

It is unfortunate that Rick is no longer on American Restorations but it is nice to see that the shop is still open to see. We visited it last year on a tour and Rick was there and very welcoming. We also got to meet Kelly and Rick's brother Ron. Great hosts.

title: Las Vegas North Premium Outlets, Las Vegas

Whether your looking for shops from Disney to Burberry this place has it. Very nice shopping center with great deals and nice clothing. Just be sure to bring extra money, you'll probably spend more than you expected without regret.

Good for a sunny day as this mall is outside. Great discounts to be had. Small food outlet for drinks and food.

And outdoor shopping mall experience with at least 150 stores. It has quite a range of stores from the high-end designer to stores for the average consumer. Certainly there seem to be stores for everyone of every age range. It would be nice to have a few more benches along the way but it is a broad boulevard between the...

Had a decent time at the outlets, bagged loads of bargains... Make sure you come with plenty of empty suitcase space!

Short taxi ride from our hotel; we were staying at the Encore. Well kept centre with plenty of places to eat/get coffee and clean restrooms. I would recommend this outlet. We have outlets here in Minnesota and the North outlet had different stores and higher end stores which is why we chose it. title: Springs Preserve, Las Vegas

review_list:
My five year old son and I called this the "desert arboretum". It was a nice place to walk around, there are some great art installations, and the children's playground was currently under construction. Its great that they are adding new things. I can see why you would become a member there because they seemed very busy with different exhibits....


More  



This is a great way to spend a sunny afternoon. Great for families to see and walk through the different parts of the gardens or exhibits. Take lots of pics and enjoy the scenery. This is also wheelchair accessable and family friendly.

the one building with the flash flood and small animal exhibit was somewhat interesting. The train ride around the park was a waste of time. There was nothing of interest to see along it and a lot of garbage along the side of interstate. We did not get out to the turtle habitat as it seemed to far to walk...


More  



We have had a membership to the Springs Preserve since it opened. It never gets old! The gardens are beautiful during any season. They have wonderful traveling exhibits as well as the ones that are permanent. Lunch at the Divine Cafe overlooking the gardens is amazing. Wandering through the Springs is a lovely way to spend the day

We loved this, as did our 6 year old daughter. Great exhibits. Great to walk around. Didn't have time to do the trails. Restaurant was the best food we had in a long weekend in Vegas. Close to downtown and the strip.

A very peaceful and enjoyable time at the Preserve. Was able to hike on the nature trials. A wonderful exhibit on Sustainability. Staff was friendly and knowledegable.

My friend and I came to Springs Preserve to see the traveling exhibit SHIPWRECK! PIRATES AND TREASURE EXHIBIT at Origen Museum. The Volunteer Guides at this Museum were friendly and knowledgeable. We were guided to an 8 minute overall introduction and background of why this preserve was so important to the founding of Las Vegas. We both agreed that the...


More  



This is a fantastic place to visit
And the cafe has outstanding food,is superb and reasonable.
I could come every day for lunch.
A must visiting LasVegas

This is a great attraction while visiting Las Vegas. Great way to get away from the tables and see how Las Vegas really started out! There is a museum and lots of outdoor walking areas to see beautiful plants and the old springs area where Las Vegas began. They even have a train ride that takes you all around the...


More  



Maybe we went on the wrong day but this place wasn't anything special. We enjoyed the flash flood room and the tiny Eco house they had, but this place isn't anything to write home about. Maybe it was because we went in the middle of the week and no special events were being held at the time. It would be...


More

title: Mandalay Bay Aquarium, Las Vegas
address: Mandalay Bay Hotel, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
Have really enjoyed a visit to the Mandalay Bay Aquarium. Love looking at all the beautiful fish, sea turtles, and more. It's a great place to take any age.....kids to seniors. I'll go again.

nice aquarium- it is pricey and a bit short, but a very good time out of the casinos- the sharks and the sea turtle were the best- they also have a petting tank with sting rays. the connected "monsters of the sea" is well worth the extra $5. It includes sea creatures professionally dissected to show remarkable details about them....


More  



Traveling with kids? this is a great place for kids and adults. Lots of pools with different fish and sharks. Lots of ocean life. Good Time!

The aquarium is very well done. Beautiful exhibits. I even saw a shark eat one of his tank-mates (a small fish) right in front of me! Nice alternative outing for all ages. Only complaint is that 20 bucks is a bit pricey for something that is about a one hour visit.

We decided to stop in here because we had a Costco coupon. It was a cool place but I would think it would be geared more toward children. It had a touch tank and many many neat fish to look at. The shark aquarium is cool, the sharks swim around you. I probably wouldnt go again but I dont regret...


More  



Our family loves visiting aquariums and the Mandalay Bay Aquarium does not disappoint. Good variety a species. Great attraction for all ages. Very clean and relaxing atmosphere.

This is a great place to take kids while you are in Vegas. The only down side is the cost and how short it is.

We visited Las Vegas at the end of October and I love aquariums, so this was a must for me. They had the place decorated with Halloween decorations, so there were skeletons and body parts floating in some of the tanks! Very cool. I really enjoyed the experience.

I thought an aquarium inside of a casino was bound to be just a couple of gimmicky fish tanks, but went anyway because my wife really wanted to go. I am glad we did go because I was very wrong. This is a serious aquarium with beautiful specimens in numerous tanks arranged to make it feel like you are walking...


More  



This is a great place to spend a hot (or cold) afternoon, especially if you are staying at the south end of the Strip (Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, Tropicana, MGM, or NYNY)
It can easy be walked through in half an hour or it can keep small fry occupied for well over an hour if you just want a relaxing...

title: Planet Hollywood Casino, Las Vegas
address: 3667 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Great place to see! Staffs were great and nice. Lots of slots and table games to play. Staff were friendly. Lots of restaurants and bars. Makes you feel excited to be there.

Casino staff was great. Dealers, waitresses, etc...... DO NOT waste your money on the Spa. Highly overpriced for a glorified gym.

Fun place, this the best place to gamble. They have great staff and awesome music. Will be back in June lol

More comps please!! I spend good money at the total rewards casinos but have never received a comp room. For this reason I stay only where I receive free rooms. Everything else is great at planet Hollywood.

Good food, lot of variety of food to choose, love the crabs, great service, will be back, nuff said <3 <3 <3 <3

Casino was clean and had an exciting environment. Wait staff at slot machines was not very good. Did not come around very often and when order was placed, it took a long time to get order delivered.

played a few low priced slots because i don't like to loose money. scantily clad dancer in some areas, but not offensive. waitress with free drinks available quickly.

its in the middle of strip. amazing view. everything is walkable. food is amazing, buffet, earl sandwhich. casino games are everywhere.

Planet Hollywood is another great Hotel. It very lively, a great gaming floor fantastic. You have a variety of different places to eat and don't forget the shopping. Staff is very curious

We enjoyed an hour at that casino before Britney Spears. It is huge with many gaming opportunities. It seems to have above average ventilation.

title: The Casino at The Mirage, Las Vegas
address: 3400 S. Las Vegas Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
There is A large area with slot machines and gaming tables
Didn't see a non smoking area
Wait staff very slow to bring drinks
Common areas very crowded and somewhat difficult to navigate

My wife and I stayed here for five nights. The room was very nice. If you like Premier league football you can't go wrong, both the games I was missing by being away were shown live on the TV service in the room. The casino has a good atmosphere and the other facilities are really nice and well kept. The...


More  



The casinos all try and compete with different themes and decorations but it's the same casino over and over again. The Mirage has decent drinks as floor service but you'll find that you'll get lowlifes in there as a result.
It's worth a visit but if you don't like gamble just don't go to Vegas

Face it....If I go to the smallest or non fancy casino but hit big, I am going to think it was great. I did not play table games. I set aside a certain amount of money and only won 1/3 of it back. I had fun. The floor configuration can be confusing and you go in circles. The drink attendants...


More  



This is another large, clean well run casino. The staff are friendly and attentive. It is a beautiful location. Seems less noisy and smokey then other casinos which is a big plus. Surrounded by some great dining at all price points - we loved the BLT Burgers during our visit this year.

not impressed with the service on the casino floor, hard to find unless you hit your service button and still a long wait for service, smokey and smelly

We (a couple) took a late night stroll in the Mirage casino. Without gambling in this place, it still made a good impression on us.
Right after the entrance of the casino, we discovered a quite big tropical forest located under the glass dome. The sounds of rainforest together with its fresh aromas made our mind to travel to Polynesia...


More  



Great casino, well laid out and plenty of choice for the slots and the tables.
Lots of people always coming over with free drinks which is always an incentive to stay.

This casino is like the rest--smokey, tacky, same games, same setup, different carpet. This one is a little cleaner than most, but that's the only big difference.

I usually stay here when I go to Vegas. They have great rooms and the best location. Price of rooms are good too.

title: Casino at Encore, Las Vegas
address: 3121 Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
We go here every week. It's the nicest place on the strip. The drinks are the best,not like the dishwater other places serve.

I'll give the Encore this, it's pretty. I liked the decorations and layout but frankly...it's just another casino!
It's worth a visit but if you don't like gamble just don't go to Vegas.

Aside from the carpet patterns, the casinos are all the same and are impossible to tell apart! Smokey, tacky, not worth going into except to pass through on your way to the sights at the hotel.

We travel around the globe often and have stayed in many extraordinary hotels. Encore ranks among the very best in terms of service, décor, quality of furnishings, design and functionality. The suite in Encore is very well thought out. It is not huge, but spacious enough to make one's stay most enjoyable. Our favourite hotel by far in Las Vegas....


More  



We recently stayed 3 nights at the Encore and I really enjoyed the Casino there. It is a luxury atmosphere yet very quiet and relaxed because it's not crowded. Drink attendants are attentive and come back fairly quickly with your drink. I ordered pina colada and strawberry daquiri and the drinks are good quality! I'm looking forward to going back...


More  



Every time I go to Vegas I make the time to walk through the Encore lobby and casino. It is so beautiful with attention paid to every imaginable detail. The encore is linked to the Wynn
so be sure to find their floral exhibit near the front of the hotel. The balls of flowers, gardens and the mosaic floor is...


More  



Very pretty, decorated in reds. Not as smoky as most. Beautiful place & not crowded at all. Worth visiting

If you know anything about Las Vegas you know that it would not be where it is today without Steve Wynn. Wynn opened the Mirage, Treasure Island, Bellagio and owned the Golden Nugget downtown (I may be missing a few!).. and then one day he sold it all to open his crown jewel, which was self entitled the "Wynn" hotel...


More  



To be honest, I don't see much difference between the Wynn and Encore casino's. Both are very nice but Encore's seems smaller somehow. Very elegant.

Encore has changed a few things about their casino. It's more interactive now meaning that one can party and gamble at the same time .
It is by far a smaller casino than its sister Wynn, but still clean with good cocktail service. I'm happy with it because i won a pretty amount :)

title: The Smith Center, Las Vegas
address: 361 Symphony Park Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89106
review_list:
This was our second visit to this magnificent building and we were again impressed by this beautiful structure. As a architecturally entertainment masterpiece, it certainly rivals other venues of its kind in the world. Already acclaimed for the world class acts it attracts, I would certainly recommend this stop for any Las Vegas resident or visitor.

Visited the smith center to watch a group perform. This is a beautiful venue, nice and intimate. The staff was a little protective warning me not to take any pictures. I was just checking my phone for messages, but other than that, the service was really good and the venue is very clean.

The first thing you see is a fine, elegant building. Its restrained art-deco architecture is beautiful and striking - just right in fact for what the Center is - an elegant opera house for Las Vegas.
And Vegas has needed an opera house for many years - a venue for higher quality shows, as well as a showpiece for 'our...


More  



No matter which venue you attend it is all well done, from the main hall to the Jazz hall everything is outstanding. The staff goes out of there way to assist your every need. Great sound system. Their prices are very fair, we go as oftem as we can

My first time sitting in the 5th row almost center was incredible. I always enjoy watching the individual players "experience" the music they are playing. Being so close I was able to hear almost every section blending their parts. Zuckerman played along with the orchestra making his violin sing. After the intermission they played Tchaikovsky's 5th Symphony. Wow what an...


More  



As a frequent visitor to Las Vegas, I have my own special place to go for wonderful entertainment at reasonable prices surrounded by a luxurious venue and the finer residents of Las Vegas. The Smith Center for the Performing Arts is a beautiful venue both for larger performances and is home to the Las Vegas Philharmonic Orchestra, as well as...


More  



If not world class, certainly among the best in the nation. An excellent venue for serious music and dance, Broadway musicals, and even a jazz cabaret.

I was born in Las Vegas in the 60s and I have seen the city transit from not only a place for gambling, but a place to find entertainment not available on the strip. As a kid, we had to travel to Los Angeles to see Broadway shows, ballet, concerts, etc. I am so please to see this venue in...


More  



The greeting was warm from the usher at the door. The venue was warm and cozy. The menu was cute and very appetizing. The show started on time and she was 65 and stunning. Her songs were on and off Broadway, The Beatles and Neil Diamond.
Great show, good food, fun night.

What a great performance! I have had the opportunity to see many different performances of the nutcracker and this one was truly unique. It was the classic show with a hint of vegas style. The three story house as part of the set was amazing! The costumes were beautiful. But the real great part is the ending. I will not...

title: Nostalgia Street Rods, Las Vegas
address: 5375 Cameron Street #M, Las Vegas, NV 89118
review_list:
Amazing collection of memorabilia and street rods. This has obviously a long time labour of love for both Art Goldstrom and his wife Shirley that he lost a few years ago. I am grateful that the continue to allow the public to see all of this. Thanks to Suzette who provided good information and humor on our tour. To top...


More  



I'm not much into cars however it's hard not to be impressed with this collection. Suz was informative with the history of many cars. Glad I went after all.

Lots of neat stuff to see. Lady tour guide from California, can't remember her name, was very nice and informative. Our favorite was the flat nosed dodge truck and the t buckets.

This was the greatest private collection of not only street rods, cars, and trucks but all kinds of vintage items. Since we were the only ones there we had a wonderful private tour with probable more information than a large group would receive. Thank you so much for sharing such treasures with the public. Loved everything we saw. Such beauties.

Had a guided tour found all of the cars awesome to look at if your a car fan go and have a look. Much better than counts customs or Vegas rat rod

Great fun, Jaw dropping memorabilia! A mini tractor with a 350 Chevy engine. A motorized toilet scooter. Besides the very cool cars, if you like memorabilia you'll love this tour!

I was looking for a vintage sign gift shop and ran across this amazing collection of cars, trucks, model planes and all sorts of memorabilia I hadn't seen the likes of for years, or never. I was by myself that morning so I got a one on one tour. My tour guide was full of information about the pieces in...


More  



An impressive personal collection of memorabilia extending many generations including past and current celebrities, athletes, and presidents. Can't believe that someone can amass such and impressive collection. The hot rods were all mint, only can wonder what the collection is worth?

This is the most eclectic "car" museum ever. It is a private collection of a man and his wife - it is not just cars. For example there is a "car-b-que", a collection of Cabbage Patch Dolls, sewing machines, custom "cars" made out of a toilet, a helicopter engine, wheelchair. This place is a lot of fun.
